reviews.title: Always good to be back
reviews.text: Returning to this hotel after 5 years, it was the same pleasure to see its garden and enter the spacy rooms. A few tens of meters from the round-about, there is a small gem hidden behind the walls. Yes, some car traffic is noticeable when being outside, but everything else compensates this fact. The service is attentive, garden beautiful, restaurant very good (dinners) and the rooms are large and comfortable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And what a view through your full size window at night: the enlightened bamboos give a tropical feel. That much I loved it that I did not pull the curtains and fall asleep within this heavenly place (room 205).
reviews.title: We expected a bit more than that ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is also a small garden swimming pool ( too cold to be used this time) and fitness.
reviews.title: Beautiful surrounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend this small estate.
reviews.title: An oasis outside Perpignan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our last one-night-stop on a trip through France and Spain. Judging from the reviews here and also the price we expected it to be above average. Unfortunately it wasn´t. Located close to the motorway it looks a bit like a seventies motel from the outside. The reception and also the service of the staff in the restaurant where we went for dinner was rather cool and impersonal. We felt as if they didn´t really care whether we there or not. The room was ok but not more than that. Furniture seemed a bit outdated, but I do not want to complain about that. If you expect nothing more than a motel to spend the night, it is ok. There sure had been better places for us along the way. And: I can only repeat the warning somenone had posted here: Do not park your car under the trees !!!
reviews.title: If it were located more scenically would be a 5

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a long stay in Spain, we always look forward to our first night in France at the Villa Duflot.
reviews.title: An oasis of civility just across the French border
To Good to just be "over night stop"
reviews.text: It is supremely civilised. Comfortable rooms, many overlooking the gardens and pool.....and an excellent restaurant. The joys of starched white tablecloths and napkins and attentive waiters is a welcome change from the Spanish world.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are never disappointed. The Villa Duflot is quiet, well appointed and efficient. And importantly, it is a hairsbreadth off the motorway....so you can just slip off in the evening and back on in the morning. Highly recommended!!
reviews.title: Never disappoints, after ten years of staying there.
Interesting hotel- comfortable - great stopover
reviews.text: We now have stayed several times, last visit December 2012 on route to Austria. The first time we stayed it was so good we stayed an extra night. THe Resturant is allways full of local "French" guest's. The rooms are more like suites, and for those travelling with dogs, they are made very wellcome, just 20 minutes off the motor way on your way up or down from UK or Spain.A real hidden gem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelling between France and Spain Villa Duflot is an excellent stop near the frontier. Easy access from the motorway with secure parking and lovely large, well-furnished rooms. Although "in the middle of nothing interesting" the hotel has gardens and a pool to look out onto. There are also rooms surrounding the courtyard.
reviews.title: Wonderful and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Am sure the Crossroads motel will mean nothing to a lot of of people but hopefully one or two of you will remember it. This hotel is not for anyone who would like to take a walk outside the hotel as it's situated just off the autoroute. It is probably better suited to a short business stay over rather than part of a holiday itinerary. The pool is very poorly situated it has a wrought iron rail around one side and on three sides are the dining tables. Having been travelling for quite a while, I just wanted to relax by the pool, my husband and I were the only ones there,well, that is if you didn't count the staff setting up the tables for lunch. At about 12pm the restaurant began to fill up, quite soon when I looked up from my book, I saw a crowd of diners on all sides, it made me feel like I was on stage, very uncomfortable and although I wanted to get in the pool there was no way I was going to with all those people sitting, watching.
reviews.title: Reminded me of Crossroads motel....

reviews.text: Dinner there was good but the most expensive we had over our 2 weeks in France.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We heard some scratching noise in our room , just above the curtains,sounded like a mouse. A very nice chambermaid arrived to investigate, with ladder and pest spray she said it must be a wasp or bee, if so it must have been the biggest wasp in the world! After a while when she too heard the scratching,we were offered another room. Our second night there was pretty much a sleepless one for me, as I was worried about mice.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, nice restaurant

reviews.text: Good food,nIce bottle of complimentary red wine on arrival but overall the expense,location and pool would not intice me back
reviews.title: Wow factor and great business venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated not too far from the main autoroute south to Spain and it is a good, quiet stop for the tired traveller. It also has the best restaurant in the region.
reviews.title: nice short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Villa Duflot many times as it is handy between France and Spain. Our room this time (No. 206) was perfect and I believe has been renovated with new fabrics. Although it did not have a separate shower (as other rooms) it was very comfortable.
reviews.title: We need more hotels like this one.

reviews.text: The restaurant, as always, was packed and the food was excellent. The foie gras beautifully presented and flavourful.
reviews.title: If there is better food in Perpignan or even South West France I'd be surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I said to the lady at reception when paying our bill, "it is always a pleasure to stay here".
reviews.title: Lovely relaxing place but service is spotty

reviews.text: Stayed here for a short two day break. Whilst not perfectly located every other aspect including the service of this hotel / restaurant is superb. The weekend menu is only 27Euros for a three course meal and is excellent by any standards. The locals use it for special occasions and it is easy to see why!!
reviews.title: Very nice decor... If you can't make it to Italy !

reviews.text: Very nice hotel with garden, pool & a great restaurant just outside Perpignan (approx 10 minutes /12€ to get in or out of town in a taxi).
reviews.title: La Villa Duflot is a good restaurant with rooms
